intro: Dyschoriste ciliata, commonly known as the silky dyschoriste, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, ovate leaves with silky hairs. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple, arranged in whorled clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in horticulture.
